properties.short description: Capua Given to Anfusus, Roger II's Son
properties.description: Before returning to Sicily, Roger II granted the rule of Capua to his son, Anfusus.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Adam Avenel or Robert de Bassonville Given Comital Title
properties.description: Roger II granted either Adam Avenel or Robert de Bassonville a charter.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Adam Avenel, Count
Robert de Bassonville
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Elder Son of Roger II Promoted to the Principality of Bari
properties.description: An unnamed older son of Roger II's was elevated to the Principality of Bari.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II appointed Joscelin as procurator over all his land.
properties.description: Roger II chose Joscelin, alongside others, to govern his land in his absence and to protect it.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
